ratings.comment: I loved this class! Suri gives fantastic lectures and kept my attention despite taking an 8 am class. There is a lot of reading each week, but the books are surprisingly good. If you work hard, do the readings and put time into the assignments, you will do very well.
He was a really great professor. He kept the class interesting even for the non-history person. He is now working at the University of Texas at Austin. I really enjoyed his class
Great professor, very enthusiastic, loves the subject, very tough class but you will enjoy it

Suri is the most well-spoken Professor I've had at this university. He never makes a mistake and makes his points with a forceful voice. Suri is an unbelievable teacher and I would take any other class offered by him in the future. Only downside of 434 is that he missed several lectures, understandable because he was flying in to Washington.

My favorite Prof so far at Madison. I have taken both his 434 and 102 classes. Currently in 434 and it is definitely harder but totally worth it. Any trouble and Suri is really approachable and helpful. He makes you think about history instead of just memorizing random facts that seem to mean nothing.

Take any class offered with Prof. Suri. He is one of the most intelligent men out there and is the greatest professor I've ever had. He brings in new ideas and makes class interesting, he's absolutely amazing.
This guys is a badass. He knows what he talks about, and he is a very organized lecturer. More professors should learn how to do their job from him!

My favorite prof at Madison so far. Lots of reading and the papers will stress you out, but you will learn so much. Easily stayed awake for the 8am power lecture, as someone else mentioned. If you don't like history but need it as a requirement, definitely take this class. I hope I will be able to take another class with Suri.

I hated history before his class. He made the subject interesting. No memorization. He focuses on the social movements and what was actually happening for the people experiencing it. He's passionate about what he teaches and very interesting to listen to. I learned a lot and learned to enjoy history.

Jeremi Suri is an awesome professor. His "power" lectures happen at 8 am, yet he makes me stay awake rather than fall asleep. Great orator! As for the work.. You will read for this class.  A lot. And the exams are a tad difficult, as he asks you an extremely broad question and you have to reply to it in 1200 words. Take this class! You'll like it.

As everyone else has said, Suri is a great teacher. This class is not that hard to get an A in, look at the grade distributions. As long as you go to class, pay attention and do the readings you can easily get an A. Sure the midterm and final are stressful, but he grades them very easily knowing that students only have 48 hours. Take this class!

Like the comments below have mentioned, this class is definitely a challenge. Suri is an outstanding professor who is funny, interesting, and knows how to give a great lecture. However, make sure you are extremely interested in the class because there is a lot of reading and each of the midterm/finals (2 four page papers) are demanding.

Difficult class, midterm and final are a lot of work. Suri is one of the best profs in the history department. He will get you to look forward to coming to class, even at 850 am! Highly recommended for anyone interested in foreign policy. Suri will change your outlook on America's role in the world.

Suri is amazing! Such a good lecturer, very interesting. I actually looked forward to the class even though it's at 8:50. Midterm & final are kind of tough, but not too hard to handle. He's a really nice and funny guy and actually gets to know his students (and knows their names). Loved this class!

Workload is heavy, but this professor is one in a million. Take 600 with him if you can, fellow history students. His lectures are amazing. Don't expect to sleep after getting his exam. Expect to learn a lot in the process though. He selects good TAs, as well.

Gives an interesting lecture, and is very competent with the material. But the written exams are impossible, the reading tedious and overwhelming, and his egotism does nothing to encourage enthusiasm toward the class. I'm a history major, yet this has been my least favorite class this semester.
Good lecturer

He was a great professor, exams were challenging but manageable. GO TO OFFICE HRS! He will be very helpful and encouraging, not only for the class, but for your life goals. Very intelligent and interesting, going to class is a must, but a good one. Not a class for nonhistory majors, but a superb one if you are. HIGHLY recommend any class by him!

Excellent lecturer.  Lots of material.  The take home essays are challenging.  I worked into the early hours of the morning before they were due on both of them.  Grading is tough but fair.  Significant amount of work for 3 credits, but a worthy experience.

I definitely learned a lot from this class.  Suri has very interesting perspectives on the issues.  However, this may not be the class to take if you have a heavy semester load because there is tons of reading and the take home midterm (2-4 pg essays in 2 days) is really difficult if you don't have a lot of time over those particular days.

Great lecturer but his exams are  nearly impossible to well on!! seriously! they are in no way fair, or an accurate representation of what you learn in the course. I would love to see the curve in this class. The only kids who get A's are probably the ones in the professor's  section. Brilliant professor... but egotistical, impossible,**** exam

Probably the best college Professor I've had hands down. Brilliant mind, open to questions and discussions, and he's very good at remembering faces (if not always names). Great guy, would take his class again and indeed anything taught by him.

This guy could teach me about watching wet paint dry or grass grow and I would be riveted.  FANTASTIC lecturer.  Very personable.  He WILL remember YOUR face, so don't skip class and go somewhere he may see you!  The only bad thing is there is a TON of reading for the course.  But it is worth it for Suri.  Best prof I've ever had!  I worship him!
good class.  take home miderms are b.s. --write 2 four page essays in 48 hours...boo.  suri is nice to look at though
so nice and helpful- he wants students to succeed

The man is scary-brilliant, honestly. He's also one of the most fascinating, engaging lecturers I've had at UW-Madison. I'll also echo the comment about doing him out of sheer respect for his amazing intellect.

I am a bit confused as to why so many people love this guy. He is a very knowledgable man, however, the class was extremely dry, he skips huge sections of American history, and it will be difficult unless you have some background in the subject. The TAs aren't veyr helpful and they look for specific responses to prompts. Very hard to get an A.

Tons of reading, but you can work around it if you know how to **** essays. Definitely a very smart guy and a good lecturer... doesn't rely on powerpoints though so i suggest bringing a computer to class. Tests are take home essays.

Amazing prof!  His lectures were wonderful and really make one think of history in new ways.  You will not want to miss his class.  Essays are hard but doable.  I am looking to take as many classes with him as I can.  Go to lecture, take the class, have fun listening to him.  The UW is lucky to have Suri teaching there.

Best lecturer I have ever heard. You won't miss his class because you won't want to miss what he has to say. Absolutely brilliant. I end up taking unnecessary notes, just to remember what he has said. If you care about history of politics at all, you want this professor. Superb.
Heavy reading load. You have to do all of it to do well on his "big picture" esaay midterms. However Suri is amazing and loves what he does. He will make you love history too.

I'm an auditor and he takes as much time with me as with the credit students. He's the best professor I've had since Lee Dreyfus in 1966. His lectures are organized and on-point and he illustrates that history is a continuum and shows how the past is relevant today. Absolutely excellent.
Undoubtedly the most brilliant instructor I have ever had.  I'd probably do him out of sheer respect.
Great lecturer. Believe him on the first day when he says he will recognize you. Tons of reading, but his lectures make it worth it. Has interesting perspectives that make you think.

You will have to read a lot, but he is absolutely worth it. Best teacher I've had so far. He really knows everything about the class and is extremely good at making it really interesting. I would definitely take another class of his!!!
Awesome

Took 433, loved it so much I took 434 just to have him as my prof again. Truly brilliant, great lecturer, very interested in what his students are doing and always willing to help. This man had lunch with his Chad section every week just to chat and see what we were up to. Lots of work/reading, but worth your time. TAKE A CLASS WITH SURI.
best professor at madison--his class is amazing and thought provoking
Extremely competent.  Heavy workload.  Fascinating perspective.  Very thorough.  Suspicion:  Jeremi Suri does not sleep.

Awesome prof. Extremely good lecturer. His lectures are very point driven and he rarely rambles. Lots of reading, but the reading always is talked about in class. Don't take this class if you don't have time to put into it but if you do it is definitely worth the work.
Seems friendly and helpful, but he is not a nice person.
Brilliant man with amazing lecturing ability.

Took this class through Chadbourne, which had him as the lecturer and the person teaching the discussion section. Any guy who does that goes far beyond what normal profs do for undergrads, and his character matches that effort

love his lectures.... they sound like speeches and debates. he doesn't rely on powerpoints, which i really appreciate, they are great, interesting and easy to follow. he's a very very very intelligent guy. :)

This man is on the forefront of American Historical perspective. He is incredibly informative, helpful, friendly, and approachable. It's an easy class to get an A in if you do all the readings and go to all the lectures. Tests are take home, there is one paper, and class partic. is vital. Probably one of the most pertinant classes at UW-Mad today.
Friendly and intelligent. I can't comment much beyond that, since the ILC Roundtable is a joke of a class.
Wonderful man--very entertaining and interested in what he is teaching.  A lot of reading, which he definitely helps clarify in class.
The best prof I have had here at Madison.  He is truly concerned about students, fair with homework, and gives lively/substantive lectures.  Absolutely one of a kind!!!!!
